intro: Lepidaploa canescens var. canescens, commonly known as the hairy lepidaploa, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Its leaves are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. The flowers are usually yellow or white, and the plant is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions.
